data.title: Golden State Warriors Roster
data.meta_description: Golden State Warriors scores, news, schedule, players, stats, rumors, depth charts and more on RealGM.com
data.text:
2025 second round draft pick to Washington, Boston or Dallas

Washington will receive the less favorable of its 2025 2nd round pick and Golden State's 2025 2nd round pick; Boston will receive the Washington pick, the Golden State pick, Dallas' 2025 2nd round pick if conveyable, or Detroit's 2025 2nd round pick protected for selections 56-59; Dallas may receive, and Washington may receive an additional, one of the four (via Detroit to L.A. Clippers to Portland to Detroit; via Detroit's right to swap Golden State for Washington (via Brooklyn); via Boston's right to swap Detroit, Golden State or Washington for Dallas; via Detroit to Washington) [Brooklyn-Golden State, 7/7/2019; Brooklyn-Detroit-L.A. Clippers, 11/19/2020; Brooklyn-Indiana-L.A. Lakers-San Antonio-Washington, 8/6/2021; Brooklyn-Detroit, 9/4/2021; L.A. Clippers-Portland, 2/4/2022; Detroit-Portland, 7/6/2022; Boston-Detroit, 6/28/2023; Boston-Dallas-San Antonio, 7/12/2023; Detroit-Washington, 1/14/2024]

2026 second round draft pick to Oklahoma City

Golden State's 2026 2nd round pick to Oklahoma City (via Atlanta) [Atlanta-Golden State, 7/8/2019; Atlanta-Oklahoma City, 7/12/2023]

2027 second round draft pick to Washington

Golden State's 2027 2nd round pick to Washington [Golden State-Washington, 7/6/2023]

2028 second round draft pick to Portland

Golden State's 2028 2nd round pick to Portland [Atlanta-Detroit-Golden State-Portland, 2/9/2023]

2030 first round draft pick to Washington

Golden State's 2030 1st round pick to Washington protected for selections 1-20; if this pick falls within its protected range and is therefore not conveyed, then Golden State will instead convey its 2030 2nd round pick to Washington [Golden State-Washington, 7/6/2023]

Stephen Curry was selected as the #7 pick in the First Round of the 2009 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Stephen Curry signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on July 8, 2009. Stephen Curry signed a multi-year extension with the Golden State Warriors on October 31, 2012. Stephen Curry re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on July 6, 2017. Stephen Curry signed a multi-year extension with the Golden State Warriors on August 6, 2021.

Draymond Green was selected as the #5 pick in the Second Round of the 2012 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Draymond Green signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on August 8, 2012. Draymond Green re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on July 9, 2015. Draymond Green signed a multi-year extension with the Golden State Warriors on August 3, 2019. Draymond Green re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on July 8, 2023.

Jonathan Kuminga was selected as the #7 pick in the First Round of the 2021 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Jonathan Kuminga signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on August 3, 2021.

Kevon Looney was selected as the #30 pick in the First Round of the 2015 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Kevon Looney signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on July 7, 2015. Kevon Looney re-signed to a contract as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on July 10, 2018. Kevon Looney re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on July 11, 2019. Kevon Looney re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on July 9, 2022.

Moses Moody was selected as the #14 pick in the First Round of the 2021 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Moses Moody signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on August 5, 2021.

Brandin Podziemski was selected as the #19 pick in the First Round of the 2023 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Brandin Podziemski signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on July 3, 2023.

Gui Santos was selected as the #25 pick in the Second Round of the 2022 NBA Draft by the Golden State Warriors. Gui Santos signed a multi-year contract with the Golden State Warriors on November 7, 2023.

Kyle Anderson was acquired in a sign and trade by the Golden State Warriors from the Minnesota Timberwolves on July 6, 2024.

Buddy Hield was acquired in a sign and trade by the Golden State Warriors from the Philadelphia Sixers on July 6, 2024.

Gary Payton II was acquired in a trade by the Golden State Warriors from the Portland Trail Blazers on February 9, 2023.

Lindy Waters III was acquired in a trade by the Golden State Warriors from the Oklahoma City Thunder on June 27, 2024.

Andrew Wiggins was acquired in a trade by the Golden State Warriors from the Minnesota Timberwolves on February 6, 2020. Andrew Wiggins signed a multi-year extension with the Golden State Warriors on October 15, 2022.
